p: In the subpopulation with data on joint involvement in the acute phase (n = 73, including 37 no CCA and 36 CCA), the majority had articular disorders (69 patients, 94.52%) with joint pain (90.41%), swelling (42.46%), stiffness (27.40%), arthritis (20.55%), tenosynovitis (13.70%), and enthesitis (10.96%). The most affected joints were the ankles (68.49%), the wrists (58.90%), the distal interphalangeal joints of the hands (36.97%), the knees (50.68%), and the proximal interphalangeal joints of the hands (45.20%).
